sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: File.FullPath returns a string representing the full absolute path name in Turing format (forward slashes) of the path that is passed to the function. The path name passed in does not have to describe an existing file or directory.
sections.mdown_content:
**File.FullPath **returns a string representing the full absolute path name in Turing format (forward slashes) of the path that
is passed to the function. The path name passed in does not have to describe an existing file or directory.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The full path name will be in Turing format and include the drive name (for example "d:/turing/examples/games/SpaceGame.t")
sections.mdown_content: The full path name will be in Turing format and include the drive name (for example "d:/turing/examples/games/SpaceGame.t")

sections.title: Example
code:
var pathName : string
        get pathName
	put "Full path = ", File.FullPath (pathName)
sections.raw_content: This program obtains a path from the user and then outputs a full path name based on the path.
sections.mdown_content: This program obtains a path from the user and then outputs a full path name based on the path.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Another example is available that checks whether a file and all of the directories in the path to the file exist. This program illustrates the use of File.FullPath, File.Parent, File.Exists, and Dir.Exists.
sections.mdown_content:
Another example is available that checks whether a file and all of the directories in the path to the file exist.
This program illustrates the use of **File.FullPath**, **File.Parent**, **File.Exists**, and **Dir.Exists**.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling File.FullPath, not by calling FullPath.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **File.FullPath**, not by calling **FullPath**.
